page.title: 04Whittlebury Fete
page.content: The fete is held annually in the grounds of Whittlebury Cottage in aid of the parish church. This year it took place on Saturday, 25th May, beginning at 3pm. A celebrity from Radio Northampton declared it open. Stalls were Cakes, White Elephant, Plants and Ice cream. Side-shows were Hoop-la, Bowling, Darts, Treasure Hunt, Skittles, Plates in Barrel, Under-the-Arches and Bran Tub. Irish dancers entertained. Admission charges were 15p for adults and 10p for children. Grand Draw tickets cost 5p each and prizes were 20 pounds, bottle of whisky, premium bond, leg of lamb and a fruit cake. There were a number of guessing competitions. Refreshments were served in a marquee. A total of 904 pounds was raised.
